EXPERIMENT DESCRIPTION
======================

Multiple IOTA nodes were watched to check how fast milestones propagate through the network.

NODE SAMPLE SELECTION
=====================

A public node list (combined synced nodes from iotanode.host + iota-nodes.net) consisting of over 400 nodes was
filtered by cyclux#5704 for nodes having ZMQ enabled on port 5556. A total of 49 nodes could be gathered this way.
A single node had to be removed from that sample because of ZMQ connection issues.

EXECUTION
=========

48 Nodes were tracked through ZMQ for the topic 'LMI' (latest milestone index).
Software used: https://github.com/mikrohash/milestone-propagation-tracker
Tests were performed on 10/May/2018 from 15:58 to 16:04 (GMT)

EXTRACTED DATA
==============

Time required for each milestone to fully propagation to all nodes:

#447688:  5218ms
#447689:  5580ms
#447690: 15387ms (only 4938ms ignoring a single node lacking behind / runaway value)
#447691: 25778ms (only 5924ms ignoring a single node lacking behind / runaway value)
#447692:  4805ms

CONCLUSION
==========

Milestones reached 48/49 nodes within 6 seconds for 5/5 tested milestones. Therefore, it seems that connectivity
in the IOTA node topology is good enough to not cause major lags (e.g. resulting in the selection of old tips)

RAW DATA
========

row 1: timestamp in ms
row 2: milestone
row 3: amount of nodes having received the milestone / sample size
